name: Tournament Tracker
description: The one-stop shop for all official osu! tournament correspondence and information
detailedDescription: Tournament Tracker is a comprehensive platform for tracking osu! tournaments and managing official tournament support. It also serves as a central hub for all tournament information, resources, and communication between the Tournament Committee and the community.
highlights: OAuth integrations with osu! and Discord
Comprehensive internal voting platform with many vote formats
Tickets platform for general inquiries and tournament reports
A collection of useful tools for tournament staff

name: AxerBot
description: General-purpose Discord bot with osu! features related to mapping & modding
detailedDescription:
AxerBot is an open-source Discord bot that's oriented towards the osu! community, providing a wide range of features related to mapping & modding.
It's used by +100,000 users across +2,000 servers.
highlights: OAuth integration with osu! for authenticating new server members
Automatic role assignment based on osu! roles
A message logging system for edits and deletions
Many osu! related commands using the osu! API

name: BN Management
description: Management platform for the osu! mapping and modding ecosystem
detailedDescription: Platform for managing Beatmap Nominator (BN) applications, nominations, and Nomination Assessment Team (NATs) internal operations.

name: Daily Challenge
description: Web application for managing osu! daily challenges
detailedDescription: Daily Challenge is a web application for organizing [osu! daily challenges](https://osu.ppy.sh/wiki/en/Gameplay/Daily_challenge), where staff members can create and manage 'weeks' of daily beatmaps.

name: Project Loved CLI
description: A command-line tool for managing Project Loved operations
detailedDescription:
A command-line tool for managing [Project Loved](https://osu.ppy.sh/wiki/en/Community/Project_Loved) operations including news generation, forum thread management, mapper notifications, and voting results processing.
This project is the successor to clayton's [Project Loved CLI](https://github.com/cl8n/project-loved), rewritten with safety, flexibility, and code readability in mind.

name: Mapset Verifier
detailedDescription: Mapset Verifier (MV) is a desktop app which tests quantifyable issues in [beatmapsets](https://osu.ppy.sh/help/wiki/Beatmaps) from [osu!](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osu!), such as unsnapped objects and unused files. Many of these issues would otherwise disqualify the map from being [ranked](https://osu.ppy.sh/help/wiki/Beatmap_ranking_procedure#ranked). Although mainly aimed at [Beatmap Nominators](https://osu.ppy.sh/help/wiki/Beatmap%20Nominators), this can also be used by mapset creators and reviewers to speed up [the ranking process](https://osu.ppy.sh/help/wiki/Beatmap_ranking_procedure).

name: MVTaikoChecks
description: A set of osu!taiko-specific Mapset Verifier checks
detailedDescription:
MVTaikoChecks is a plugin for [Mapset Verifier](https://github.com/Naxesss/MapsetVerifier) that adds a collection of checks specific to osu!taiko beatmapsets.
This plugin is widely used by the [osu!taiko](https://osu.ppy.sh/wiki/en/Game_mode/osu!taiko) community to ensure that all taiko beatmapsets are up to standard.
This plugin has been ported to the official Mapset Verifier project.

name: osu! wiki
description: The open-source knowledge base containing a wide range of information related to osu!
detailedDescription: The osu! wiki is a collaborative knowledge base for the osu! community, containing a wide range of information related to osu!. It also serves as the source for the osu! news articles.

name: Book Lending System
description: A microservices-based backend system deployed to Kubernetes via CI/CD pipelines
detailedDescription:
A microservices-based backend system for managing users, books, loans, and late return penalties. Demonstrates REST, GraphQL, gRPC, and Kafka. 
The project is deployed to Kubernetes via CI/CD pipelines using Helm charts, ArgoCD, and Jenkins.
highlights: Microservices-based backend system for managing users, books, loans, and late return penalties
Demonstrates REST, GraphQL, gRPC, and Kafka
User management system with role-based access control
Book and loan management system with CRUD operations
Late return penalty management system with CRUD operations
CI/CD pipelines for deployment to Kubernetes

name: Unisson
description: Service sharing platform designated for special events and parties
detailedDescription: Service sharing platform designated for special events and parties, made as a graduation project for my computer science bachelor's degree.
highlights: Comprehensive social media features (comments, reviews, etc.)
Admin panel for managing users and content

name: Seibooru
detailedDescription: A tag-based image hosting platform, inspired by [Danbooru](https://danbooru.donmai.us/), made as a graduation project for the [GOMYCODE](https://gomycode.com/) Fullstack Web Development Bootcamp.
highlights: Admin panel for managing users and content

name: Alert Service
description: A web application serving as a pager
detailedDescription: A web application serving as a pager for sending very loud alerts to my phone.

name: kanban-board
description: A web platform designated for collaborative project management
detailedDescription: A web platform designated for collaborative project management, inspired by [Trello](https://trello.com/), and made for my Summer 2025 internship at [Mobelite](https://www.mobelite.fr/en/).

name: CVE Tracker
description: A web platform for tracking and analyzing CVEs
detailedDescription:
A hackathon React/Vite app for analyzing CVEs and vendor risk using live NVD, EPSS, and CISA KEV data.
This project was made during the [Nuit de l'info 2025](https://www.nuitdelinfo.com/) hackathon.
highlights: React/Vite hackathon app for CVE and vendor risk analysis using live NVD, EPSS, and CISA KEV data
Clean frontend architecture with React Router, reusable UI components, and feature-based folders
CVE analysis view with summary stats plus detailed per-CVE risk, exploitability, and impact data
Vendor overview dashboard with time-based filtering, key risk metrics, and CVSS trends
